findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: PAV - Pair Address Validation
findings.description: The contract is missing address validation in the pair address argument, which can introduce security risks and potential attacks.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract uses misleading error messages which do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured from user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
